ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: increased Mandarin reading, speaking, and listening ability
Chinese language skills.
better speaking skills, chinese culture, history
Improved all facets of Chinese skills
Improved my Chinese

CHNS 140 is a great course that really furthered my progress in Chinese. This course focuses on honing students' ability to hold longer conversations and write more sophisticated essays in Chinese. It covers many different topics and teaches Chinese culture along with a lot of new vocabulary.
I learned a lot of Chinese this semester!  I improved my understanding of chinese, my speaking skills, and my reading skills.  I also made some new friends in class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength is that it is structured and the homework is really easy to track with the daily schedule, and you learn a lot.
too much homework, but very good instruction

Strength: You definitely improve at Chinese
Weakness: Lot and lot of work. Sometimes the work feels like it doesnt help and is just busy work. Classes can sometimes be lackluster.

The strength is having Chinese practice every day and a lot of speaking and listening. The weakness is that some of the assignments were useless. In-class presentations had little educational value, as we just memorized our essays and wasted a class every week on listening to others' presentations. Handwriting a pre-written essay was annoying and didn't help with studying characters because I was just automatically copying characters from the digital version. Friday's session assignments weren't helpful as well. I'd love to have more listening/reading assignments instead of the three types of assignments above.

Weakness: The material needs to be updated for modern Chinese conversations.
Strength: The constant class time forces your Chinese to develop.
The course is very rigorous, and I think it could use more speaking practice.  Sometimes I found there was too much focus on reading/writing, which I think is less important than speaking practice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, if you are interested in learning Chinese, the course is extremely engaging and you learn A LOT through a myriad of different activities. The course is very well structured.
Yes, it is really good for improving your chinese.
yes
Take it if you want to learn Chinese since you really have no other option. You should be fully invested in learning Chinese if you take this course.
Yes, Chinese language is very useful

I would recommend this course to any student that seriously wants to pursue their studies in Chinese. The workload is quite a lot with homework assigned every night but it is a very organized course and you learn a lot while making a big step towards speaking Chinese at an advanced level.
I would recommend, but with caution.  Chinese is a very difficult language, and getting a good grade in this class requires a lot of time and energy.
